nodes.text: Keep Our Republic Secure was a propaganda poster illustrated by the Zeltron artist Yosyro Modoll during the Clone Wars. During the war, some in the Galactic Republic feared that administrative droids could be utilized as spies by the opposing side, the Confederacy of Independent Systems. As a result, pieces such as Modoll's Keep Our Republic Secure were created as reminders of the importance of security.

In the forefront of Keep Our Republic Secure stands a silver-plated personal assistant droid modeled as a shapely humanoid female. In the background, a large silhouette of the mask worn by General Grievous, leader of the Confederacy's Droid Army, can be seen. At the top of the poster, written in High Galactic, is "Do you know who else she's talking to?" At the poster's lower left, also in High Galactic, is written "KEEP OUR REPUBLIC SECURE! Wipe Your Droid's Memory Regularly."

Keep Our Republic Secure was illustrated by Russell Walks and pictured in the book Star Wars Propaganda: A History of Persuasive Art in the Galaxy, written by Pablo Hidalgo and released on October 25, 2016.
